description:
The font name to use throughout the application. It is recommended
to use Roboto or Noto, but it can be whatever.

The font family for the application. This only combines the `$md-font-name`
with a fallback font of `sans-serif`.

usedBy.description:
This includes the css for simple typography in react-md. It will
update all items to use `box-sizing: border-box`, set the font
family, set the line-height, text-rendering, and create the base
class names for the typography. If the `$extend-html-tags` is true,
the `h1` - `h5`, `p`, and `caption` tags will be updated with the
corresponding css class name.

context.name: react-md-typography

description: The line height to use on almost all elements.

context.name: react-md-typography

parameter.name: light-theme
parameter.description:
Boolean if the application
    is using the light theme.

parameter.name: extend-html-tags
parameter.description:
Boolean if the base html tags should
    be updated or not.

parameter.name: include-media
parameter.description: Boolean if the media queries should be included.

description:
Creates the css for typography on mobile devices. This should be used in
a media query.

usedBy.description: Includes the css for typography on mobile and desktop screens.

description:
Creates the css for typography on desktop screens. This should be used in
a media query.

usedBy.description: Includes the css for typography on mobile and desktop screens.

description: Includes the css for typography on mobile and desktop screens.

update all items to use `box-sizing: border-box`, set the font

context.name: react-md-typography

description:
Themes the typography in react-md only if `$light-theme` does not equal `$md-light-theme`.
This goes into effect by modifying the base html tag with the `$html-class-name` you give.

context.name: react-md-theme-typography

parameter.name: html-class-name
parameter.description: The class name to use for the base html tag to override styles.

parameter.name: light-theme
parameter.description: Boolean if using the light them.

parameter.name: extend-html-tags
parameter.description: Boolean if the base html tags should get styled as well.
